topic.title: Replacing the Vulkolian Wheels on the Vertical Carriage

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Replacing the Vulkolian Wheels on the Vertical Carriage (Task)

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Step-by-step task procedure to safely remove and replace Vulkolian wheels on the vertical carriage, including lockout-tagout and post-replacement tests.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: vulkolian wheels; bolts; vertical carriage; alignment tools; torque wrench

li.p: Move the vertical carriage into the lower maintenance position.

ul.li: Follow the instructions in Section 3 to position the vertical carriage.
Follow the instruction in Section 2 above to lockout-tagout-verify the power to the lifting station is off.
Enter the safety fence area.

li.p: Insert both safety bolts into the corresponding bores on the vertical carriage lifting mast and fasten the fixing plate.

ul.li: Always make sure that the safety bolts for the vertical carriage are properly installed before carrying out work on or near the carriage.

note.p: An unsecured vertical carriage can fall down and cause serious injury or even death.
There are several crushing points on the machine that can cause injuries! Do not reach between the following points.

ul.li: Vertical carriage and the steel housing
Vertical carriage and the lifting mast
Locking pins and the container
Vertical carriage and the horizontal carriage

li.p: Remove all guide wheels for the vertical carriage in the following manner

ul.li: Loosen the lock nuts (A).
Twist and remove the adjusting screws (B).
Insert a screw (C) into the threaded hold at the end of the axis.
Push the wheel in the direction of the cylindrical cut-out (see red arrow).
Hold the wheel and pull out the axis with the help of the inserted bolt in the direction of the blue arrow.
The wheel and the bearings can now be removed from the assembly.
Place the new wheel with the new bearings between the cylindrical cut-outs.
Push the axis into the bearings of the wheel.
Push the axis in the direction of the running surface.
Twist the adjusting screws until they hold the axis in position.
Tighten the lock nuts.
Remove the bolt.
Check the position of the vertical carriage and correct it if necessary.
Remove the safety bolts.
Remove all tools and accessories.
Ensure that all personnel have left the safety fence area and that the safety fence doors are closed.
Verify that all safety components are in place.
When leaving the fenced area, press the Door Reset button.
Remove LOTO and re-install the 3 circuit breakers in the MSK control cabinet.
At the control panel, cancel any faults by pressing the Reset Fault button on the control panel.
Also, press the Reset Safety Fence Area button.
Ensure that no personnel are near the equipment, or in the safety fence area.
Return the system to the Start position in Manual mode.
Then switch the system to Automatic mode. (For details, see SBS-OP-026 Operating the Lifting Station.)
Observe the operation to ensure that the lifting station is working properly.

note.p: There is a serious danger for anyone inside the safety fence area when the lifting station is turned on.
